content: dog poop bag holder this pattern is free you can sell items made from this pattern but do not sell this pattern this is written in us crochet terminology materials worsted weight yarn red heart with love caron one pound red heart super saver etc ◦ fluffy yarn is best for the body if you are using a thinner #4 weight yarn caron simply soft as an example want the bag roll to fit in loosely or stitch tightly you probably want to add an extra increase row between 2 and 3 so there are 25 stitches in each round ◦ the black yarn for the face and the pink yarn for the butt can be any worsted weight yarn you prefer 3 5mm crochet hook or your preference for amigurumi small button for the top loop abbreviations blo single_crochet back loop only single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet decrease double_crochet two together single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet increase two single_crochet in the same stitch trc3tog triple crochet three together this is the same as a triple crochet decrease but with all three legs of the stitch in the same loop this is similar to a bobble stitch treble_crochet decrease triple crochet two together with the legs in different stitches x# repeat the part in the brackets the specified number of times body chain 10 and slip_stitch into the first chain don t twist the chain rounds pictures are at the end 1 single_crochet increase single_crochet x5 15 single_crochet 2 2 single_crochet single_crochet increase x5 20 single_crochet 3 chain 6 this will be the tail so adjust length as desired and slip_stitch into the 2nd chain from the hook and each chain stitch 7 single_crochet trc3tog 5sc trc3tog 6sc when you connect the single_crochet at the end of the round make sure the tail is outside the body 4-9 single_crochet in each stitch 20sc for each row 10 9sc trc3tog 4sc trc3tog 5sc this should line the top feet up over the bottom ones adjust if needed 11-12 single_crochet in each stitch 20sc for each row 13 11sc 2 decrease 7sc this is centered over the front feet so if you adjusted for 10 you will need to adjust here as well if desired switch to dc3tog for a more pronounced muzzle 14-16 single_crochet in each stitch 20sc for each row 17 8sc 2blo single_crochet 5sc 2blo single_crochet 3sc these are where you will attach the ears so adjust for desired ear position 18 ch1 if working in the round chain 2 if not double_crochet all the way around this is where the cord will go 20dc 19 single_crochet in each stitch tie off the yarn 20sc round 1 round 2 making the tail making the feet after making the muzzle completed body ears slip_stitch onto the first loop chain 3 treble_crochet decrease one leg on each loop chain 3 slip_stitch onto the second loop repeat for the second ear butt with pink yarn single_crochet in each loop of the starting chain tie off 10sc
